Section 20.2

20.2 A recursive structure p In this section, we modify the idea of superimposing a tree of degree u p on top of a bit vector

V: Advanced Data Structures

Chapter 20: van Emde Boas Trees

O(log log U) operations for integers in [0, U)

Key Points

  • Exploits fixed universe size U
  • Recursive structure with âˆšU clusters
  • Much faster than BST for bounded integers
  • Space: O(U)

Real-World Applications

Very fast priority queues for integer keys
